data.title: India Knight: my brilliant friend Deborah Orr
data.meta_description: Deborah Orr died last October. She was almost horrifyingly clever, completely relentless, quick, precise, devastating (a champion heckler). data.text:
Deborah Orr died last October. She was almost horrifyingly clever, completely relentless, quick, precise, devastating (a champion heckler). She was wholly original in her thinking and never, in the 20-odd years I knew her, said a single boring thing. And she was a raving beauty, like something by Rossetti by way of William Blake, just saved from being an actual vision by her truly appalling teeth. Later she had all her teeth removed in one go and then replaced with implants. The dentist found it so traumatic, she had to take the next day off. Deborah was fine.

I met her because I was dating a friend of hers. Her ex-husband [the writer Will Self] was intimidating enough, but Deborah was in another league. Luckily
